q: Since the beginning of the breath analysis the blood test has no longer been used as an alcohol control.

At a breath test an S appears on the screen..

q: During an alcohol control the police also asks for the car registration.
optiona: You don't have to have it in the car and therefore you don't have to show it.
optionc: You give the original document or a color copy.

q: You are being tough and you refuse an alcohol control. You'll get an immediate temporary ban of (______) hours.

optiona: No, because you are below the limit.

q: The result of a breath analysis shows 0.40mg/litre alcohol in the exhaled alveolar air. Do you get a temporary driving ban ?
optiona: No, because you are below the limit.

q: When do you have a less positive alcohol level ?
optiona: Equal to 0,22 mg or more alcohol per litre exhaled alveolar air.
optionb: When more than 0,22 mg alcohol per litre exhaled alveolar air.

q: When you are drunk and driving, the reaction/thinking distance will be ______
optionc: ... the same as when you're sober.

q: An accident without casualties and material damage only.Is it enough that the people involved fill in a European/International Accident Form ?
Is a first aid kit obligatory in the car ?
A driver of a moped has fallen to the ground.
optionb: You leave the helmet on the head.

q: What is the European emergency number ?
An injured person asks for a medicine. Should you give it to him ?
On regular roads a warning triangle must be placed (...) meters behind the vehicle.
You have hit a cyclist with your car. What do you do first ?
An ambulance with blue flashing lights and a warning siren. What do you do ?
optionb: You drive to the side and give priority.

q: An arm is bleeding.
optionb: You tie off the upper arm.

q: Are you allowed to follow an ambulance with your heavily injured father on board, if it is driving faster than the maximum speed limit ?
In your side mirror you see an ambulance with blue flashing lights, but you don't hear a warning siren.
optionb: You drive to the side and give priority.

q: When do you have to call the police ?
optiona: It is best with any accident.
optionb: Only with an accident with casualties.

q: A young cyclist is involved in an accident. At what age (______) must he show his identity card ?
The warning triangle must be visible to oncoming traffic from ... meters.
In an accident a driver hit his head against the front wind shield and is now unconscious.
optiona: You carefully get him out of the car.
optionb: You have to leave him in the car.

q: What do you write in the big white space of the accident form which is used for the situational sketch. 1. The road and traffic signs (lights, signs, road markings). 2. Vehicles. 3. Direction of the vehicles 4. 1, 2 and 3.
At home you notice that you forgot to draw something important on the situational sketch.
optiona: You are still allowed to draw extra.
optionb: You are not allowed to change anything on the form.

q: An accident in a tunnel, but there is no smoke or fire. How do you warn the emergency services ?
optionb: Preferably by an emergency phone in the tunnel.

q: What do you do first when you see a casualty ?
optionb: Remove any obstruction from the mouth.
optionc: Move him into a safe position.

q: Who has to offer assistance in an accident with casualties ?
optionb: The driver as well as the passengers.

q: When you see this sign, you know the tunnel is at least (...) meters long.
What do you do when there is a big fire in a tunnel ?
optiona: You reverse to exit the tunnel.
optionb: You exit the tunnel through an emergency exit.

q: When you phone with a hands free kit, you pay less attention to the traffic as well as without a hands free kit.
What do you have to fill in together on a European/International Accident Form ?
optionb: The front and the back page.

q: An accident with only material damage. There is an argument. What do you do ?
optionb: Mention it on the accident form.

q: You notice an accident in the other direction of the motorway. What do you do ?
optiona: You stop at the first emergency phone.
optionb: You stop on the hard shoulder, take your first aid kit and offer assistance.

q: At what distance (... meters) behind the broken down vehicle do you place a warning triangle on the hard shoulder on the motorway ?
An accident with material damage only on the motorway. Where do you have to fill in the accident form ?
You are involved in an accident with material damage only on a junction. What do you do first ?
There is a queue because of an accident on the right lane. Who gets priority to drive on on the middle lane ?
Who has to fill in the European/International Accident Form ?
An accident with little material damage. What do you do first ?
optionb: Fill in the European/International Accident Form.

q: You're involved in an accident. Is it obligatory to show your identity card to the others involved in the accident ?
optionb: No, only in an accident with casualties.

q: You never drive on a motorway. Is the reflective safety jacket then obligatory in the car ?
You return from your holiday. What do you remove from the rooftop ?
optionb: The ski box and the roof rack.

q: You have to transport bicycles. You place them ______
optiona: ... at the back of the car.
optionb: ... on the roof of the car.

q: What is the most environmentally friendly fuel ?
Driving with open windows consumes less fuel than with closed windows.
You drive with a diesel. What is the recommended speed (revs) to change gear ?
When you have to stop in front of a drawbridge, it is best to switch off the engine.
Are you allowed to re-cut badly worn tyres of a car ?
optionb: Yes, when the tread depth can be made deeper than 1.6 mm.

q: Exhaust fumes in contact with the sunlight will lead to ______
When you drive with a roof rack on top of your car the fuel consumption is only a bit higher. That's why you don't have to move it when you don't need it.
A dirty air filter in the engine ______
optionb: ... has no influence on the fuel consumption.

q: When you drive too long in a too low gear ______
optiona: ... it has no influence on the fuel consumption.
optionc: ... it ensures a higher fuel consumption.

q: The air conditioning is on in the car. The result is ______
optionc: ... no influence on the fuel consumption.

q: You drive 80 km/hour in 4th instead of 5th gear. The fuel consumption is ______
The fuel of your car is petrol. What is the recommended speed (revs) to change gear ?
Which diesel is the most environmentally friendly ?
optionc: Diesel with a less sulfur level.

q: Badly worn tyres are allowed to be re-cut when they can get a tread depth of 1.6mm.
The marks in the grooves indicate when the minimum tread depth is reached. It is then time to change the tyre.
To check the oil level, the car must be on a flat surface. But when should you check the oil level ?
e: TECHNIQUE - Engine oil is one of the most important fluids in your vehicle. It lubricates moving parts, prevents overheating and wear, and helps keep the engine clean. To get a reliable reading, you should check the oil level when the engine is cold and the car is parked on a level surface. If the oil is still warm, it may not have fully drained back into the oil pan, leading to an inaccurate reading.
optionb: After driving a few kilometres so the oil is warm.

q: The minimum tread depth of a tyre must be (...).
When are snow chains allowed ?
optiona: When there is snow or ice on the road.
optionb: Between the 1st November until the 31st March.

q: You start a steep hill downwards (1) or upwards (2). What do you do ?
optiona: You shift into a higher gear.
optionb: You shift into a lower gear.

q: You have to make a long journey.
optiona: You increase the tyre pressure a bit.
optionb: You lower the tyre pressure a bit.

q: On a dry road surface the braking distance with ABS is  (______) than without ABS.
When are studded tyres allowed ?
optiona: When there is snow or ice on the road.
optionb: Between the 1st November until the 31st March.

q: It is winter and it is snowing constantly. What is the best thing to do with the tyres of your car ?
optiona: You increase the tyre pressure a bit.
optionb: You lower the tyre pressure a bit.
optionc: You don't change the tyre pressure.

q: ESP is the abbreviation of 'Electronic Stability Program' - In Dutch we talk about: Elektronisch stabiliteitssysteem.
What is the tool called that prevents you from slipping when you suddenly have to change direction ?
You approach a bend. When do you brake ?
optiona: You brake well enough before the bend.

q: Your car starts slipping. What do you do ?
optiona: You pull the steering wheel shortly to the left and to the right.
optionb: You release the gas pedal and declutch.

q: What is the recommended speed (revs) to change gear with an petrol engine ?
Your  driving gear is too low. The fuel consumption will be ______
Where do you keep your left foot after changing gear ?
optionc: To the left of the pedal.

q: The function of motor oil. 1. Has a cleaning and lubricating function. 2. Ensures that the moving parts don't touch each other. 3. Prevents the motor from blocking. 4. All above are correct.
On a tyre you can see: 165/70 R 14 81 T. The R stands for Radial. What does the 14 next to the R stand for ?
On a tyre you can see: 165/70 R 14 81 T. The R stands for Radial. What does the 165 stand for ?
optionb: The width of the tyre in mm.
optionc: The diameter of the rim in inch.

q: It is important to change the tyres every 10.000 or 15.000 km. How do you have to switch them ?
What is the function of motor oil ?
optionb: Only lubricating and cooling down of the engine.
optionc: Lubricating, cooling down and cleaning of the engine.

q: In what order do you fasten the bolts after changing a wheel ?
The light of ABS keeps burning while driving, this indicates a malfunction. How do you react ?
optiona: You immediately stop and call the roadside assistance.
optionb: You can keep on driving without any problems.

q: What does the 205 on this tyre mean ?
optiona: The width of the tyre in mm.
optionc: The diameter of the rim in inches.

q: What does the 55 on this tyre mean ?
optiona: The width of the tyre in mm.
optionc: The diameter of the rim in inches.

q: Which tool ensures the car from slipping and keeps it steerable when you suddenly need to hit the brakes ?
Which tool ensures the car from slipping and keeps it steerable when you suddenly need to change direction in front of an obstacle ?
How do you have to brake with ABS ?
optionc: Pushing hard on the brake pedal.

q: What are the consequences when your tyre pressure is too low ?
optionc: Higher fuel consumption and quickly badly worn tyres.

q: If a driver sees this sign, then he may drive ...
e: Obligatory direction - He may not turn to the left.
optionb: ... just to the right or straight ahead.
optionc: ... to the left or right or straight ahead.

q: Must you (the blue car) also give priority to the right, when you drive on a one-way street ?
e: Obligatory direction - If you're driving on a one-way road, you should also grant priority, except of course when there is a traffic sign indicating you have priority.In this example, the brown car may drive first.

q: If you see this is under plate, it also applies to speed pedelecs.
e: Obligatory direction - It also applies to pedelecs (P) but not to mopeds class A.

q: This white underside applies to:
e: Obligatory direction - If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to speed pedelecs. If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to speed pedelecs and mopeds class A.
optionc: Bicycles, mopeds class A and speed pedelecs.

q: This white underside applies to:
e: Obligatory direction - If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs. If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.
optionc: Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs.

q: Which vehicles can come from the other direction ?
e: Obligatory direction - If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs. If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.
optionc: Bicycles, pedelecs and mopeds class A.

q: What does this traffic sign indicate ?
e: Prohibited direction No entry for drivers of quads.
optiona: No entry for drivers of motor vehicles with four wheels and quads.
optionb: No entry for drivers of quads.
optionc: No entry for drivers of quads and motorcyclists.

q: If you see this is under plate, it also applies to speed pedelecs.
e: Prohibited direction Speed Pedelecs are mopeds.

q: Which vehicles can drive past this board ?
e: Prohibited direction If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs. If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.
optionc: Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs

q: Which vehicles can drive past this board ?
e: Prohibited direction If the letter P is mentioned, it also applies to pedelcs. If the letters P and A are mentioned, it also applies to pedelecs and mopeds class A.
optionc: Bicycles, mopeds class A and pedelecs

q: On a highway, only a towing service that has been called by the police can tow a car. What happens on an express road ?
e: The express road - If your car breaks down on a highway or an express road, the police call a towing service they prefer.
optiona: You may ask a friend to tow your car.
optionb: A towing service that you call can tow.
optionc: The police will request a towing service.

q: The brown car driver wants to turn left. May he drive onto the intersection ?
e: Traffic lights - Although the light is green, the driver of the brown car must not drive the intersection yet. He has to wait until the intersection is free.
optiona: Yes, because the light is green.
optionb: No, because the intersection is not free.

q: This traffic light for a tram has the same meaning as ...
This traffic light for a tram means:
optionb: In every direction you can drive on.

q: This traffic light for a tram has the same meaning as ...
e: Traffic lights - An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green traffic light.

q: You're waiting in your car when the traffic light is red. May you constantly give some gas to keep warm the engine ?
e: Traffic lights - Gently give gas while you wait (broum ... broum ... broum ...) may not.

q: What does the white / yellow flashing light mean in the middle of the lights for a tram ?
e: Traffic lights - Important: double caution and compliance with the priority rules.
optiona: Tram must be driven very slowly due to a possible defect on the tracks.
optionb: You may cross the light with double caution, with due observance of the prevailing priority rules.

q: The traffic lights are defective. Who has priority ?
e: Traffic lights If the traffic lights are defective, then the usual priority rules apply. There are no signs under the lights that control the priority, so priority from the right.

q: The traffic light is green, but the crossroads are not yet free. May you stay on the zebra crossing while waiting for the intersection to be free ?
e: Traffic lights - You must not cross the crossroads unless the light is green and the crossroads are free. But you cannot block the crossing point while waiting.

q: The round traffic light is green and you want to turn left. But the evacuation arrow is not burning yet.Can you cross the crossroads ?
e: Traffic lights - A left-hand green arrow placed separately when crossing a crossroads means that the opposite traffic on the lane that leaves the drivers on the left will be held by a red light to facilitate clearing of the intersection.

q: This sign says there are traffic lights (150 meters further). This plate is ...
e: Traffic lights - This danger or warning sign means traffic lights. Danger signs are placed 150 meters before a danger.

q: The left and right lane are closed. There must be zip-merge. Car B drives first. Who can drive next ?
e: The lanes - The car in the middle lane gives first priority to the car on the right lane and then priority to the car on the left lane. Then car A may drive.
optiona: Car A on the middle lane.
optionb: Car C on the left lane.

q: A child must be less than (...) years to ride on a footpath within built-up areas.
e: The bicycle lane - In built-up area and outside built-up area: under the age of 10 years (31/05/2019). Outside built-up areas, all the cyclists, except if there is a bike path is in their direction of travel.

q: Are the cars allowed to ride on the rush-hour lane ?
e: The motorway - If a green arrow hangs above the rush-hour lane, cars may drive on that lane.

q: This driver drives as far as possible to the left on his lane on the motorway.
e: The motorway - You should drive on the right side of the roadway and as much as possible on the right side of your lane.
optiona: It is allowed, when he stays on his lane.
optionb: He has to drive as far as possible to the right.

q: What is the maximum speed limit for the blue car on this motorway ?
e: The motorway - The speed limit only applies to the bus lane.

q: The pink car drives on the merging lane of a motorway. Who has priority ?
e: The motorway - A driver who drives on the merging lane of a motorway, has to give way.

q: There is a traffic jam. The grey car drives on the left lane on this motorway. A motorcycle wants to overtake between the left and the middle lane. Where should the car driver drive on the lane ?
e: The motorway - In a queue motorcycles are allowed to ride: between the two left lanes of traffic. at a maximum speed of 20 km/hour faster than the other vehicles.. and at a maximum speed of 50 km/hour.So the grey car drives as far as possible to the left, to give place.
optiona: As far to the left as possible.
optionc: As far to the right as possible.

q: You want to drive on to the motorway via the merging lane.
e: The motorway - You have to accelerate as soon as possible on the merging lane.
optiona: You accelerate as soon as possible on the merging lane.
optionb: You accelerate when you drive on the right lane.

q: An accident on the motorway. The driver positions the red warning triangle. Where should the passengers stay ?
e: The motorway - The safest place is behind the crash barriers.

q: 500 meters further is an exit. Where do you ride on the exit ?
e: The motorway - At the beginning of the exit.
optiona: At the beginning of the exit.
optionb: Approximately in the middle of the exit.
optionc: As far as possible at the end of the exit

q: Which car is properly parked in this residential area ?
e: Special places - In a residential area, you may park left and right of your direction of travel on the indicated parking places.

q: Which of these signs relate to the Maximum Authorized Weight M.A.W. of a car ?
e: M.A.W. and M.G.W. - Signs 1 relate to the M.G.W., Signs 2 , 3 (okt 2022) , 4 : M.A.W.

q: Which of these signs no longer exists since October 1ts, 2022.
e: M.A.W. and M.G.W. - Signs 1, 2 and 3 (since October 1st 2022) relate to the M.A.W.

q: What is 'autodelen' ?
e: M.A.W. and M.G.W. - People use the same car at a different time. You use the car when you need it. If you do not need the car, someone else can drive.
optiona: When multiple people use at the same a car to reach a destination.
optionb: Occasionally use a car, on pre-defined moments through reservation system.

q: You have a driving license B. You drive in a car with a M.A.W. of 2500 kg. How much is the maximum M.A.W. of your trailer ?
e: M.A.W. and M.G.W. - If the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a license B is OK, provided that the M.A.W. of the vehicle (car + trailer) is not more than 3.5 ton.

q: For material that cannot be taken apart, any load must carry a warning marker that projects more than (______) behind the car.
e: The load and the passenger spaces - From 1 meter to 3 meters.

q: The width of a vehicle and its load is maximum ______?
e: The load and the passenger spaces - A vehicle along with his load should not be wider than 2.55 meters. If wider = 'exceptional transport'(Height: up to 4 m).

q: - A diving license B allows to pull a trailer with a M.A.W. to (...) kg.
e: The load and the passenger spaces - BUT when the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a license B is ok, provided that the M.A.W. of car and trailer together does not exceed 3.5 ton. With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q: When the M.A.W. of the trailer exceeds 750 kg, a driving license B is ok, provided that the M.A.W. of the car and the trailer together does not exceed (______) ton.
e: The load and the passenger spaces - With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q: You have a provisional driving license B.Can you pull a trailer with your car ?
e: The load and the passenger spaces - With a provisional driving license B you cannot pull a trailer.

q: Heavy rainfall, but the visibility is enough. The rear fog lights ...
e: The lights - During heavy rain (in Belgium) they must be switched on.(In The Netherlands absolutely not).
optionb: ... must be switched on when the spray from heavy rainfall makes it difficult to see other cars.

q: There is heavy fog.Should the front fog lights burn ?
e: The lights - The front fog lamps are not required on a car.You are therefore never required to make them burn.

q: Is it allowed to turn on the four warning lights to alert the driver behind you that there is a traffic jam ?
e: The lights - You may only use the warning lights for signaling: . a school bus with children during embarcation or disembarcation; . a vehicle that is defective or immobilized after an accident; . a dangerous situation as it suddenly slowing the vehicles before you.

q: Is it allowed to give a warning signal with the horn of your car when you want to overtake another driver ?
e: The lights - Horn during the day: Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and thus to avoid an accident.. Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver that you want to catch up.
optiona: Yes, during the day outside built-up areas.
optionb: Yes, during the day in built-up areas.

q: You're driving and there is heavy fog. What lights are required to burn ?
e: The lights - The front fog lamps are not required on a car.You are therefore never required to make them burn.
optiona: The front and rear fog lamps.

q: The speed of the car in front of you is 90 km/hour. What is the safe following distance ?
e: The stopping distance - Via a simple formula, you can calculate that distance: the speed at which you drive, divided by two.

q: You have to slow down.Is it correct that the faster you drive, the longer the stopping distance will be ?
e: The stopping distance - The faster you drive, the longer the stopping distance.

q: The reaction time when you're tired ______
e: The stopping distance - Because of fatigue, you will react more slowly to something.

q: Two cars will cross each other on a dirt road. How much lateral distance must be kept ?
e: Crossing - The traffic regulations don't define 'how much' it must be. There is written: 'sufficient'

q: What is the meaning of this sign ?
e: Crossing - The sign that says that you should give priority, is a round sign with a red and black arrow.
optiona: Give priority to drivers coming from the other direction
optionb: Traffic allowed in both direction, after first only one way direction.

q: You approach this junction and you want to cross it. The oncoming car wants to turn left. Do you have to give it priority ?
e: Priority and changing directions - If the traffic lights work, the board under the lights has no meaning. The traffic light is green, so you're allowed to drive straight through. Your oncoming vehicle (if it also has green light), wants to turn and must want to give priority.

q: You approach this junction and you want to cross it. The oncoming car wants to turn left. Do you have to give it priority ?
e: Priority and changing directions - If the traffic lights work, the board under the lights has no meaning. The traffic light is green, so you're allowed to drive straight through. Your oncoming vehicle (if it also has green light), wants to turn left and must want to give priority.

q: Who has priority ?
e: Priority and changing directions - The red car who wants to turn right or makes the shortest turn, has priority. The white car who wants to turn left, or makes the longest turn, has to give priority.

q: Who has priority ?
e: Priority and changing directions - The driver of the white car who wants to drive straight on has priority. The driver who wants to turn left, has to give priority.

q: At an intersection you want to turn left. What do you do ?
e: Priority and changing directions - See if a car is coming behind you that you for example catches up. Turn Direction indicator on. Slowing down and turn.
optiona: Slow down - Look in the mirror - Turn direction indicator.
optionb: Turn direction indicator - Look in the mirror - Slow down.
optionc: Look in the mirror - Turn direction indicator - Slow down.

q: When there is a problem of the 'dead angle' ?
e: Priority and changing directions - Mirrors must be always correctly adjusted before you drive. But there is always a point that you can't see in the mirrors: the dead angle
optionb: Only if the mirrors are incorrectly adjusted.

q: Do you have priority at this junction ?
e: Priority form the right - Each driver who comes from the right should have priority, even if he first stopped.

q: Is the driver of the car at this junction allowed to overtake the moped on the left ?
e: Priority form the right - It's forbidden to overtake on the left animals in harness, a vehicle with more than 2 wheels and a two-wheeled motor vehicle on intersections where the priority from the right applies.
optionb: Yes, when there is 1 meter space between them.

q: Who has priority ?
e: Priority form the right - At this junction the priority of the right applies. There is not a crosswalk for pedestrians.

q: Who has priority ?
e: Priority form the right - At this junction the priority of the right applies. But there is a crosswalk for pedestrians.(Learn very well in your book when there is not priority from the right.)

q: Who is the first to cross the intersection ?
e: Junction and traffic sign - The car must give priority to MANAGERS on the intersection. A pedestrian is not a driver, but there is a crossroads for pedestrians.Therefore the pedestrian is allowed to go first.

q: Who is the first to cross the intersection ?
e: Junction and traffic sign - A triangle on its tip means that you have to give way to the drivers (not the pedestrians) that run on the path you are going to take, and that you eventually have to stop. There is no pedestrian crossing.

q: Who is the first to cross the intersection ?
e: Junction and traffic sign - A STOP means that you must stop and give way to the drivers (not the pedestrians) that run on the track you are going to take, A pedestrian is not a driver and there is no pedestrian crossing.

q: What is the safest distance between you and the vehicle in front of you when you stop ?
e: Waiting and parking - You can still see the rear tyres.
optiona: When you can still see the license plate.
optionb: When you can still see the bumper or the exhaust pipe.
optionc: When you can still see the rear tyres.

q: On which verge can you park within a built up area ?
e: Waiting and parking - Outside a built up area: on a ground level or elevated verge.
optiona: Only on the ground level verge.
optionc: On a ground level or elevated verge.

q: On which verge can you park outside a built up area ?
e: Waiting and parking - Inside a built up area: on the ground level verge. Outside a built up area: on a ground level or elevated verge.
optiona: Only on the ground level verge.
optionc: On a ground level or elevated verge.

q: On a speed hump ...
optionc: ... you may not wait and no park.

q: There is file. The car in front of you just drove over a speed hump and stops again. Can you stop on the speed hump ?
e: Waiting and parking - Just stop in a file because you cannot drive further, is not waiting or parking. Only waiting and parking are prohibited on a speed hump.

q: On this express road In Wallonia with 2x2 lanes, a car is allowed to drive maximum (______) km/hour.
e: The express road - In Flanders: 70 kph unless traffic signs or rules impose a different speed limit. In Wallonia and Brussels-capital region: 90 kph.

q: You are approaching this intersection with your car. Can you catch a two-wheeled motorcycle or moped at the crossroads on the left ?
e: Priority form the right - It's forbidden to overtake on the left animals in harness, a vehicle with more than 2 wheels and a two-wheeled motor vehicle on intersections where the priority from the right applies.
optionb: Yes, if no drivers come from the right.

q: The driver of the blue car wants to turn right.
e: Priority and changing directions - In a build-up area, he can choose the lane he wants to drive on.
optiona: He takes the first right-hand lane (1)
optionb: He takes the second right-hand lane (2).
optionc: He can choose between the first or second lane.

q: This sign means that you should be careful when changing direction, because cyclists and riders of two-wheeled mopeds follow the same public road.
e: The bicycle lane - This sign means that you should be careful when changing direction, because cyclists and riders of two-wheeled mopeds follow the same public road.

q: Beyond these signs, a child wants to cross the street in a place where is no pedestrian crossing. Do you need to stop and give priority to the child ?
e: 'The pedestrians - A pedestrian who wants to cross the roadway in a place where there is no pedestrian crossing should itself give priority. However, the message is that you should always be careful.

q: How do you react when you see a scared horse on the way ?
e: The drivers - Every driver should immediately slow down when approaching pulling animals, welding, driving or livestock on public roads. He had to stop if these animals show signs of fear.

q: What is car sharing ?

The ABS light is usually an amber, yellow, or orange light that spells out ABS and turns on during startup for a few seconds. If the ABS light stays on, then you might be dealing with a faulty ABS control module, low brake fluid levels, and a faulty wheel speed sensor.

The sooner you report it, the more likely it is that the facts will be correctly recorded. Make sure you have all necessary information, such as the location and time of the incident, the license plate of the damaged vehicle, and photos of the damage.

q: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?
e: OVER TAKING ON THE LEFT PROHIBITED - At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left: a vehicle with a trailer, a vehicle with more than two wheels, or a motor vehicle with two wheels. A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.
optionb: Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.

q: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?
e: OVER TAKING ON THE LEFT PROHIBITED - At intersections where no traffic signs regulate priority, or where this road sign is present and therefore the priority to the right applies, it is forbidden to overtake on the left: a vehicle with a trailer, a vehicle with more than two wheels, or a motor vehicle with two wheels. A cyclist is not a motor vehicle, so you are allowed to overtake them. You may also overtake a personal mobility device.
optionb: Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way ?
e: Crossing - Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

q: Are these two vehicles crossing each other in the correct way ?
e: Crossing - Vehicles must cross each other on the right. Only if arrows on the roadway indicate that they must cross on the left, is this of course allowed.

q: After which sign do you not expect cars coming from the opposite direction ?
e: 1. You have priority at the next intersection. 2. You have priority at the next intersections. 3. One-way street. 4. Mandatory direction.

q: Is a pedestrian (orange arrow) allowed to cross the road at that place ?
e: THE PEDESTRIANS - The traffic sign indicates that there is a pedestrian crossing 100 meters ahead.  A pedestrian must use it if they are within 20 meters of the crossing.  That is not the case here.
optionb: No, he must use the pedestrian crossing.

q: Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a green light ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - (1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.  (2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.  (3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.  (4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q: Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a red light ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - (1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.  (2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.  (3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.  (4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q: Which traffic sign has the same meaning as a steady amber light ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - (1) An inverted triangle has the same meaning as a green light.  (2) A circle has the same meaning as a steady amber light.  (3) A horizontal bar has the same meaning as a red light.  (4) A diagonal bar pointing left allows driving only in that direction.

q: Are you allowed to overtake the motorcycle on the left at this intersection ?
e: OVER TAKING ON THE LEFT PROHIBITED - At intersections where you have priority, you may overtake other drivers on the left.  - Priority at the next intersection.  - Priority road.  - Green traffic light.
optionb: Yes, if you leave sufficient lateral distance.

q: Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow ?
e: EXPRESS ROAD AND REGULAR ROADS - Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q: Beyond which traffic sign must you drive at least 70 km/h, if conditions allow ?
e: EXPRESS ROAD AND REGULAR ROADS - Only on a motorway (sign 1) does a minimum speed of 70 km/h apply, if conditions allow. On an express road (sign 2), this obligation does not exist.

q: The police can ask any driver to take a breath test.  Is that also the case for a saliva test ?
e: Alcohol/Drugs - In Belgium, there is zero tolerance for drugs in traffic. The police regularly carry out drug checks to determine whether you have certain prohibited substances in your body.  But a saliva test may only be carried out if the police suspect that you are under the influence of drugs, and this suspicion must be based on objective findings.
optiona: Yes, a saliva test can be imposed on any driver.
optionb: Yes, if there is, based on objective findings, a suspicion of drug use.

q: The barrier of this level crossing is open and no bell is ringing. However, the lights are out of order. Are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left ?
e: OVER TAKING ON THE LEFT PROHIBITED - At level crossings indicated by this sign, overtaking on the left is prohibited for: a horse-drawn vehicle; a vehicle with more than two wheels; or a two-wheeled motor vehicle, except when barriers are present or when the lunar white light is on.

q: On this road marking that indicates a bus stop, you may drive.  But what else are you allowed to do ?
e: Train - Tram - Bus - You are not allowed to park on the road marking that indicates a bus stop.  If there is no road marking but only a sign indicating the bus stop, you may not park within 15 meters before and after that sign.

q: What is the maximum permitted speed within a built-up area in the Walloon Region when passing the sign indicating a pedestrian crossing ?
e: SPECIAL PLACES - The sign indicating a pedestrian crossing does not set a speed limit.  Within built-up areas:  - Flanders and Wallonia: maximum 50 km/h.  - Brussels Region: maximum 30 km/h.

q: Must a cyclist also give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing ?
e: THE PEDESTRIANS - All drivers must give priority to pedestrians on a pedestrian crossing. A cyclist is also considered a driver.
optionb: No, only drivers of motor vehicles.

q: One-way street. Are speedpedelecs also allowed to ride in the opposite direction ?
e: The vehicles mentioned on the traffic sign and allowed to ride in the opposite direction are: - buses. - class A mopeds. - speedpedelecs. - bicycles.

q: A one-way street. The additional sign indicates that cyclists and class A mopeds may ride in the opposite direction.
e: The additional sign indicates that only cyclists may ride in the opposite direction.

q: Does the sign that ends all local prohibitions also put an end to parking signs ?
e: Waiting and Parking - The sign with a black diagonal stripe informs road users of the end of all regulations previously indicated by signs, except those concerning stopping and parking.

q: The windshield washer reservoir is empty. This may negatively affect the driver's visibility. What should you do ?
e: TECHNIQUE - If you hear a humming or buzzing sound when you activate the washer but no liquid sprays onto the windshield, the reservoir is empty. You should refill it as soon as possible, because without washer fluid your visibility can be greatly reduced, especially in rain or when dirt splashes up from the road. Just like engine oil, the washer fluid level should be checked regularly.

q: The photo is taken from the car you are driving. You want to turn right at the intersection. Are you allowed to drive here on the bus lane ?
e: The Lanes - When approaching an intersection, you drive on the bus lane if you want to turn right.

q: Inside a built-up area in the Walloon Region. At what maximum speed are you allowed to pass this sign ?
e: SPEED - The sign is placed at a raised roadway feature. You may cross it at a maximum speed of 30 km/h.

q: The photo is taken from the car you are driving. Who has the right of way ?
e: Priority from the right - There is no police officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the right-hand priority rule applies at the intersection.

q: You are approaching this intersection. What does the traffic sign mean ?
e: Priority from the right - The traffic sign indicates that this is an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.
optionb: An intersection where drivers coming from the right must yield.
optionc: You must yield to drivers coming from the right.

q: This prohibition sign applies to:
e: LOAD AND PASSENGER SEAT - Access prohibited to drivers of vehicles or vehicle combinations whose total length, including load, exceeds the length indicated.

q: The train has already passed. Are you allowed to drive on while the barriers are still rising ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - You may only cross the level crossing when the barriers are fully raised and the white moonlight signal is on.

q: After which sign do you have priority ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - 1. Priority to the right. 2. Road works. 3. Two-way traffic. 4. Priority at a road narrowing.

q: You want to turn right at this intersection. Do you have priority ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - The priority sign indicates that you have priority at this intersection. The blue supplementary sign indicates that the priority road bends to the right.

q: What does the yellow sign mean ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - The yellow priority sign means that you are driving on a priority road. This means you have priority at the following intersections, until you see the sign End of priority road.
optiona: You must give way at the next intersection.
optionb: You have priority at the first upcoming intersection.
optionc: You are driving on a priority road.

q: You are not allowed to park on the roadway under a bridge, but you may park on the shoulder if there is one. But are you allowed to stop on the roadway to let someone get out ?
e: WAITING AND PARKING - Both parking and waiting on the roadway under a bridge are prohibited.

q: Does this white car have priority at the intersection ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - Before the intersection, there is a sign: End of priority road.

q: You want to turn right at this intersection. You slow down and, if necessary, you stop to give way to ______
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - The priority sign indicates that you must give way to drivers on the crossing road. If necessary, stop before the inverted triangles on the road surface, also called shark's teeth.

q: This car has stopped because the traffic light is red. But is it in the correct position ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - At some intersections, an advanced stop box for cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds is marked on the road. Cars must stop before the first stop line when the light is amber or red. Cyclists and two-wheeled mopeds stop before the second stop line, which is closest to the intersection.

q: Do you have to give way to drivers coming from the left here ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNSYou want to enter a roundabout. The give-way sign (inverted triangle) tells you to slow down and, if necessary, stop to give way. On a roundabout, drivers can only come from the left. When entering a roundabout, you should not use the right indicator. You must, however, use it when leaving the roundabout.

q: Which local prohibition does the top traffic sign put an end to ?
e: Waiting and Parking - The sign with a black diagonal stripe indicates the end of all traffic regulations previously imposed by traffic signs, except those concerning stopping and parking.

q: The indication sign indicates that this is a one-way street. But what does the prohibition sign refer to ?
e: M.A.W - M.G.W - No entry for drivers of vehicles whose M.G.W. exceeds the mass indicated on the sign.

q: My vehicle has broken down. How long may my car remain on the public road ?
e: Waiting and ParkingA broken-down car may remain on the public road for a maximum of 24 hours. An advertising vehicle may remain on the public road for a maximum of 3 hours. It is forbidden to offer a vehicle for sale along the public road.

q: The light is green: you may enter the intersection...
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - Even with a green light, you may not enter the intersection if traffic from the opposite direction could block you and you risk obstructing the intersection.
optionb: ... only if the intersection is clear.

q: A minor accident without injuries at an intersection. What should you do ?
e: Accidents - In case of a minor accident without injuries at an intersection, you should try to clear the intersection. If the vehicles can still move, park them next to the roadway in a place where parking is permitted.
optionb: You place a warning triangle and leave the cars where they are.
optionc: You park the cars in a safe place.

q: Outside a built-up area in Wallonia. What distance must be kept between two parked cars ?
e: WAITING AND PARKING - Both inside and outside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 metre. Make sure to respect this rule during the practical driving test.

q: Does this traffic sign also apply to buses and coaches ?
e: This sign means: No entry for drivers of motor vehicles and trailers designed and built for the transport of goods. An additional sign underneath may limit this prohibition to vehicles or combinations whose maximum authorised mass exceeds the indicated value.

q: What are you allowed to do within 15 meters before and after the sign indicating a bus stop ?
e: Waiting and Parking - Within 15 meters before and after a bus stop, parking is not allowed. However, you are allowed to stop briefly to let passengers get in or out.
optiona: No parking, but stopping is allowed.

q: How should you react in case of a fire in a tunnel ?
e: Accidents - You stop your vehicle as far to the right as possible, leave the key in the ignition, and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.
optiona: You leave your vehicle while protecting it from theft.
optionb: You leave your vehicle and keep the key in the ignition.
optionc: You send a message to your loved ones telling them you love them.

q: You are driving on a motorway and there is fog. At what speed do you drive ?
e: The Motorway - On motorways, the minimum speed is 70 km/h, but only if conditions allow it. In case of fog, snow, traffic jams, heavy rain, etc., you must of course adapt your speed.

q: You have been drinking alcohol and you fear a police check. Is there any medicine that can quickly lower your blood alcohol level ?
e: Alcohol - Drugs - There is no medicine or other remedy (such as drinking coffee) that can make your blood alcohol level drop faster. Only time allows your body to break down alcohol. On the contrary, some medicines even intensify the effects of alcohol.

q: Alternating parking for certain vehicles. When are you allowed to park your car after this sign ?
e: Waiting and ParkingAlternating parking for certain vehicles This traffic sign indicates that the parking space is reserved for alternating parking, for example for bicycles and cars. In this example: from 6:00 p.m. to 7:30 a.m., cars are allowed to park.

q: The Biological Clock : During which hours does the combination of fatigue, reduced cognitive performance, and physiological fluctuations make the body more vulnerable, potentially leading to an increase in accidents ?
e: Explanation: Research shows that accident frequency rises during the night's low hours, especially between 2:00 and 5:00 a.m. This is because the body's circadian rhythm affects alertness, concentration, and reaction times. During this time window, fatigue and physiological weakness are at their peak, leading to slower responses and a higher likelihood of mistakes.

q: You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNSThis is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.
optiona: You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
optionb: You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.

q: You are approaching a roundabout here.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - This is not a roundabout but an intersection where the priority-to-the-right rule applies.A roundabout is indicated by the blue roundabout sign and usually has either a STOP sign or a give way sign. Here, there is no sign at all.

q: You drank beer. Your friend is sober. How will your reaction time compare to theirs ?
e: STOPPING DISTANCE - Many factors can negatively affect a person's reaction time, such as fatigue, certain medicines, or distraction. Alcohol also slows down reaction time significantly.
optionc: Alcohol has no effect on reaction time.

q: You stop behind a car that has stopped at a red traffic light.When do you keep a safe distance ?
e: TRAFFIC LIGHTS - It is always safe to leave enough distance. Driving schools teach that it is safe if you can still see the rear tyres of the vehicle in front of you.
optiona: When you can still see the license plate.
optionb: When you can still see the rear tyres.

q: You are driving a diesel car. At what engine speed is it best to change gears ?
e: ENERGY USE - The correct rev range to shift gears with a diesel engine is 1500-2000 rpm. Sequence of actions when shifting gears: 1. Fully press the clutch and simultaneously release the accelerator. 2. Shift into the correct gear. 3. Release the clutch until the biting point and gently press the accelerator. 4. Release the clutch completely and place your left foot beside the pedal.

q: There is fog and the visibility is about 150 meters. Which lights must be on ?
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - When visibility is less than 200 meters, dipped headlights must be on. The rear fog light is only mandatory when visibility is about 100 meters or less.
optionb: Only the dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
optionc: The dipped headlights, the rear fog light and the front fog lights.

q: There is fog and the visibility is about 90 meters. Which lights must be on ?
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - When visibility is less than 200 meters, dipped headlights must be on. The rear fog light is only mandatory when visibility is about 100 meters or less.
optionb: Only the dipped headlights and the rear fog light.
optionc: The dipped headlights, the rear fog light and the front fog lights.

q: The bicycle is broken. How much safe distance must you keep when overtaking this cyclist ?
e: The Bicycle lane - This cyclist is not riding. It is clearly outside the built-up area. The safe passing distance is therefore 1.5 meters. Inside a built-up area, it is 1 meter.

q: Your car breaks down in a built-up area. Normally, you place the warning triangle 30 meters behind your vehicle, so that it is visible from 50 meters by approaching traffic. But here this is not possible. What do you do ?
e: Accidents - In a built-up area, you may place the warning triangle on top of the car.
optiona: You do not place a warning triangle.
optionb: You place the warning triangle on top of your car.

q: What should you do after starting the car engine ?
e: Energy use - To reduce environmental impact and engine wear, you should let the engine run for about 30 seconds after starting, so that the oil circulates properly. Then drive gently for the first few kilometers. Letting the engine idle for a long time wastes fuel and can harm lubrication. Drive moderately until the engine reaches its normal operating temperature.
optionc: Wait until the engine is fully warm.

q: You drive past this traffic sign with your car. Are you allowed to overtake a motorcycle with a sidecar on the left ?
e: OVER TAKING ON THE LEFT PROHIBITED - The red prohibition sign indicates that drivers are not allowed to overtake an articulated vehicle or any vehicle with more than two wheels on the left. This no-overtaking rule applies until the next intersection, or it ends earlier if you see the END sign. Therefore, a car driver may overtake a two-wheeled motorcycle on the left, but not a motorcycle with a sidecar. Conversely, a motorcyclist may not overtake a car, since a car has more than two wheels.

q: You are driving and several passengers are in the car. Can you, as the driver, require them to wear their seat belts ?
e: LOAD AND PASSENGER SEAT - Everyone in the car must wear a seat belt or sit in an appropriate child seat.

q: What are you allowed to do on a raised traffic device ?
e: SPEED - On a raised traffic device, it is forbidden to overtake to the left a horse-drawn vehicle, a two-wheeled motor vehicle, or a vehicle with more than two wheels. You may overtake a cyclist.
optionc: Overtake a cyclist and a class A moped.

q: Beyond the sign, I may drive at a maximum speed of 20 km/h in the Walloon Region.
e: SPECIAL PLACES - The sign indicates the beginning of a residential zone. The maximum permitted speed there is 20 km/h.

q: It is raining heavily. I switch on the rear fog lights______
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - The rear fog light must be switched on when visibility is less than 100 meters in fog or snowfall. In heavy rain, it must always be switched on.
optiona: As soon as visibility is less than 100 m.
optionb: As soon as visibility is less than 200 m.

q: The driver in front of you falls asleep. He suddenly drives onto the cycle path. Are you allowed to use the horn in this imminent danger ?
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - When may you use the horn ? During the day: Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and prevent an accident. Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver that you want to overtake. Between sunset and sunrise: Only in case of imminent danger. In other cases, instead of using the horn, you must flash your headlights (alternate between high beam and low beam).
optionb: Only at night outside built-up areas.
optionc: Always in case of imminent danger.

q: You have hit a cyclist. What do you do after placing the warning triangle and notifying the emergency services ?
e: Accidents - An injured person should always be left in place. Do not give them food or drink. If they are bleeding, apply a pressure bandage to the wound.
optiona: You move him off the road.
optionb: You apply a pressure bandage on his bleeding arm.
optionc: You do nothing and wait for the emergency services.

q: Can someone with epileptic seizures drive a car ?
e: A person with epileptic seizures is generally not allowed to drive. After a first seizure, there is a driving ban of 6 months. Someone with chronic epilepsy who, after treatment, has been seizure-free for 1 year may, with approval from a specialist doctor, be allowed to drive again. After a new seizure, there is again a driving ban of 1 year.
optionb: Never, because they can always have another seizure.
optionc: Only after a seizure-free period can a doctor grant permission to drive.

q: You are driving on a one-way road with three lanes and you want to turn left. Where should you position yourself correctly ?
e: PRIORITY WHEN TURNING OFF - When you want to turn left, you must position yourself as far to the left as possible on the roadway.

q: A cyclist wants to cross the road using the pedestrian crossing. Does he have priority over the car coming from the left ?
e: THE PEDESTRIANS - If a cyclist wants to cross the road using a pedestrian crossing, he must get off the bicycle and cross on foot while holding the bike by hand.

q: A road narrowing. This traffic sign means you have priority over oncoming traffic.
e: Crossing - The sign announces a road narrowing, but it does not indicate who has priority. In this situation, there are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the driver on the side of the narrowing must give way.

q: This road marking warns you ______
e: Priority from the right - At intersections where priority is not regulated by a police officer, traffic lights, or signs, the right-hand priority rule applies. This road marking simply indicates that you are approaching an intersection where the right-hand priority rule is in force.
optiona: ______ that you are approaching a dangerous intersection.
optionb: ______ that you are approaching an intersection where the right-hand priority rule applies.

q: Who has priority at this intersection ?
e: Priority from the right - This is an intersection where the priority to the right applies. But the cyclist is riding on a continuous cycle path. The car coming from the right must first yield priority to the cyclist.

q: This blue sign means that in case of a road narrowing, drivers on this side of the road have priority over oncoming traffic.
e: Crossing - The blue priority sign with arrows: priority. The red priority sign with arrows: give way.

q: May a firefighter regulate traffic and give orders at the place where the fire brigade is intervening ?
e: THE AUTHORIZED PERSON - All members of the fire services present at the scene of an intervention have the authority to regulate road traffic. Firefighters may give binding orders to road users but are not allowed to draw up an official report or place traffic signs. If a road user refuses to comply with the firefighter's instructions, this must be reported afterwards to the police, who will issue the official report.
optiona: No, only the police can do that.
optionb: Yes, a firefighter can give orders.
optionc: Yes, they can give orders and also draw up a report.

q: What does this traffic sign mean ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - You are still driving on a priority road. The additional sign indicates that the priority road will end in 250 meters.
optiona: From here up to 250 meters further, no priority road.
optionb: End of the priority road in 250 meters.
optionc: Beginning of the priority road in 250 meters.

q: Within a built-up area. What distance must be kept between two parked cars ?
e: WAITING AND PARKING - Both inside and outside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 metre.

q: It has snowed. What must you do before driving your car ?
e: In Belgium, when it snows, you must clear the entire car. Start with the windows (windshield, rear window, side windows) and mirrors to ensure good visibility, then remove the snow from the roof, the hood, and the rest of the bodywork. This is both a safety and a legal requirement, since snow falling from your car can endanger other road users.
optionb: Clean the mirrors and all windows.
optionc: Remove the snow from the entire car.

q: The oil warning light comes on. Can you keep driving like this ?
e: TECHNIQUE - If the oil warning light goes off as soon as the engine is running, that's fine. But if it stays on, something is wrong. Switch off the engine immediately and do not restart it, but check the oil level. If it's too low, top up with the oil recommended in your car's manual.
optiona: Yes, but not at high speed.
optionb: Yes, but better to go to a garage.

q: This warning sign means that you are approaching a dangerous intersection.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - This is not a warning sign but a priority sign. It means that you have priority at the next intersection.

q: In foggy conditions, when must the rear fog light be switched on ?
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - In case of fog or snowfall, the rear fog light must be switched on when visibility is less than 100 meters. In case of heavy rain, the rear fog light must always be switched on. Front fog lights are not mandatory on a car, so they are never compulsory to use.
optionb: When visibility is reduced to less than 100 meters.
optionc: When visibility is reduced to less than 200 meters.

q: Which drivers are you allowed to overtake on the left at this intersection ?
e: Priority from the right - At an intersection where you must give way to drivers coming from the right, you may only overtake a cyclist on the left.
optiona: None, because the right-hand priority rule applies here.

q: Who has priority at this intersection ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - In front of the motorcycle, shark teeth markings are painted on the road. Out of view, there is therefore a traffic sign indicating that it must give way.

q: Who has priority at this intersection ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - It is an intersection where you must give way to drivers coming from the right.

q: The white car is allowed, at that place ...
e: WAITING AND PARKING - This round traffic sign, with one diagonal stripe, indicates that on the side where the sign is placed, parking is prohibited on both the carriageway and the shoulder, up to the next intersection.
optionc: Neither to stop nor to park.

q: Are you allowed to tow a broken-down vehicle in built-up areas ?
e: SPEED - It is forbidden on motorways and expressways.Where towing is permitted, the maximum allowed speed is 30 km/h.
optionb: Yes, it is allowed at a maximum speed of 30 km/h.

q: Which road marking do you see in this picture ?
e: Train - Tram - Bus - You may drive over this road marking, but you are not allowed to stop or park on it.

q: The owner of this car has already been inside the house for several minutes. The car is:
e: WAITING AND PARKING - Stopping/waiting is the time needed to let someone get in or out of the car, or to load/unload goods. The car is therefore parked.

q: You want to turn right. Do you have to give way if a car is coming from the left ?
e: Priority from the right - This is not a roundabout. There are also no signs regulating the priority. So the priority from the right applies here.
optiona: Yes, because it is a roundabout.
optionb: No, because you have priority from the right.

q: What lateral distance must legally be kept between two cars that cross each other ?
e: Crossing - The highway code states that when two cars cross each other, a sufficient lateral distance must be left.

q: There is a traffic jam. When must an emergency corridor be formed ?
e: The Motorway - In case of a traffic jam, drivers on a carriageway with two or more lanes in their direction must preventively form an emergency corridor for emergency services. This must be done before traffic comes to a complete stop. On a two-lane road: between the left and right lane. On a three-lane road: between the left and middle lane. Drivers in the right lane may not move onto the hard shoulder, the bus lane, or any special lane reserved for buses.
optiona: Only on motorways when emergency services are approaching.
optionb: Always on all roads with at least 2 lanes in the same direction.

q: You are approaching an intersection with a dirt road. There are no signs regulating priority. Do you have to give way to drivers coming from the dirt road ?
e: Priority from the right - At an intersection with a dirt road, the priority to the right does not apply. Drivers coming from the dirt road must give way.
optionb: Yes, because the priority to the right applies here.

q: At which intersection are you allowed to overtake a cyclist on the left ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection. Sign 2 = priority road. Sign 3 = priority from the right.

q: At which intersection are you allowed to overtake a moped on the left ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection. Sign 2 = priority road. Sign 3 = priority from the right. At intersections where you have priority, you may overtake a moped.

q: At which intersection are you allowed to overtake this two-wheeled motorcycle on the left ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection. Sign 2 = priority road. Sign 3 = priority from the right. At intersections where you have the right of way, you may overtake all vehicles on the left.

q: It is nighttime. The car in front of you is driving slowly. Are you allowed to use the horn to signal that you are going to overtake that car ?
e: THE LIGHTS AND THE HORN - When are you allowed to use the horn ? During the day: Inside and outside built-up areas: to warn others and prevent an accident. Outside built-up areas: to warn a driver you want to overtake. Between sunset and sunrise: Only in case of imminent danger. In other situations, instead of the horn, you must use the lights: flashing alternately with high and low beam.
optiona: Yes, but only outside built-up areas.

q: You are driving on a one-way road and you want to turn left. Where should you position yourself correctly ?
e: PRIORITY WHEN TURNING OFF - When you want to turn left, you must position yourself as far to the left as possible on the roadway.
optiona: On the right side of the roadway.
optionb: In the middle of the roadway.
optionc: On the left side of the roadway.

q: You are approaching this intersection with your car.
e: OBLIGATORY DIRECTION - The lower blue sign indicates that you may turn either left or right.
optiona: You are required to turn left.
optionb: You may turn left or right.

q: What is the maximum permitted speed within a built-up area in Flanders ?
e: SPECIAL PLACES - In Flanders and Wallonia: maximum 50 km/h. In the Brussels Capital Region: maximum 30 km/h.

q: What are you allowed to do under this bridge ?
e: Waiting and Parking - Under a bridge, you may not stop (wait) or park on the roadway, but you may on the shoulder if there is one. Before this bridge, however, a sign prohibits stopping and parking on this side, both on the roadway and on the shoulder.
optiona: Stop and park on the roadway.
optionb: Stop and park on the shoulder.

q: You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - This is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.
optiona: You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
optionb: You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.

q: You are approaching this intersection and you want to turn right.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - This is not a roundabout. There are no signs regulating priority. Therefore, the priority to the right applies.
optiona: You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
optionb: You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.

q: Are you allowed to let someone get in or out at a bus stop ?
e: Train - Tram - Bus - At a bus stop, you may drive and stop briefly. You are allowed to let someone get in or out at a bus stop. Parking there for a bus is forbidden.

q: You are approaching this intersection, and you want to turn right.
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - This is a roundabout. You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.
optiona: You have priority over drivers coming from the left.
optionb: You must give priority to drivers coming from the left.

q: Where must you leave at least 1.5 meters of lateral space when overtaking a cyclist ?
e: OVERTAKING ON THE LEFT - When overtaking outside built-up areas, a driver must leave a lateral distance of at least 1.5 meters between their vehicle and a pedestrian, cyclist, or two-wheeled moped. Inside built-up areas, the required distance is 1 meter.

q: On a bus lane, it is forbidden to ______
e: Train - Tram - Bus - A bus lane is not a part of the roadway. Therefore, it is forbidden to drive on it, being stationary on it, or to park on it. You may only use it a few meters before an intersection to turn left or right.

q: Is this car allowed to move to the right lane ?
e: The lanes - The solid white line is on his side. He is not allowed to cross it. After overtaking, however, a car may cross the solid line to return to the right lane.

q: What is not allowed before and after this sign ?
e: Waiting and Parking - This round sign with two diagonal stripes means that, on the side where it is placed, there is a prohibition of being stationary and parking on both the roadway and the verge. If numbers appear inside the sign, the rule applies only to the roadway.
optionb: Only being stationary and parking on the roadway.
optionc: Being stationary and parking on the roadway and the verge.

q: Beyond which sign are you not allowed to drive a car ?
e: Prohibited direction - Sign 3: This prohibition sign means that drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels and motorcycles with a sidecar are not allowed to drive past the sign. In the opposite direction, they are allowed. Sign 1: End of motorway. Sign 2: End of expressway. Sign 4: Dead-end street.

q: Friday afternoon. You have passed the theory exam. The town hall is already closed to get a driving licence. Are you allowed to drive a car already ?
e: THE ROAD OR CARRIAGEWAY -  The certificate showing that you passed is not a valid provisional driving licence. With it, you are definitely not allowed to drive.

q: You are entering an intersection. Suddenly, a police officer raises his arm. What do you do ?
e: THE AUTHORIZED PERSON - When a police officer raises his arm, it means that all vehicles must stop. Vehicles already in the intersection must leave it as quickly as possible, continuing in the direction they intended to go.

q: Which traffic sign will you see when you want to enter the motorway via the acceleration lane ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - When entering the motorway, you must give way (and stop if necessary) to drivers already driving on the motorway. You do not have to drive until the very end of the acceleration lane. You may merge as soon as it is safe. When joining the motorway, no zip-merge is applied.

q: Which traffic sign means: end of expressway ?
e: Prohibited direction - Sign 1: End of motorway. Sign 2: End of expressway. Sign 3: This prohibition sign means that drivers of motor vehicles with more than two wheels and motorcycles with a sidecar are not allowed to drive past the sign. In the opposite direction, they are allowed. Sign 4: Dead-end street.

q: Your car starts to skid. In which direction should you look ?
e: TECHNIQUE - Although braking is probably your first instinct, you should avoid braking too hard. This can cause the wheels to lock and reduce traction. What should you do instead ? Look in the direction you want to go. Unconsciously, you will steer towards where you are looking. You can imagine what happens if you keep looking at the danger. Steer in the opposite direction (counter-steer). Press the clutch and release the accelerator.
optionb: Towards the direction you intended to go.

q: You are driving in the inner lane of a two-lane roundabout. What must you do to exit ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - To exit a two-lane roundabout from the inner lane, you must first change lanes to the outer lane, using your right indicator. You must give way to vehicles already driving in the outer lane. If you cannot do this in time, it is safer to make another loop around the roundabout rather than blocking traffic or creating a dangerous situation.
optiona: Stop and wait until the cars in the outer lane have passed.
optionb: Exit directly, you have priority over the cars in the outer lane.
optionc: Keep circulating until the outer lane is free so you can exit.

q: A priority road outside built-up areas. On which shoulder are you allowed to park ?
e: Waiting and Parking - Outside built-up areas, you may park on any shoulder along a priority road, unless prohibited by traffic signs or local police. Make sure not to obstruct other traffic. Also, you may not stop or park within 5 meters of an intersection and within 20 meters of a traffic light.

q: A priority road within a built-up area. Where are you allowed to park on the roadway ?
e: Waiting and Parking - You are not allowed to park (but you may stop briefly) on a priority road outside a built-up area. Inside a built-up area, parking is allowed, except: within 5 meters of an intersection. within 20 meters of traffic lights.
optionc: Both within and outside a built-up area.

q: How should you react if you approach a horse with a rider and the horse rears up in fear ?
e: THE ROAD OR CARRIAGEWAY - If a horse on the road gets scared by a car and rears up, the driver must stop the vehicle and avoid any sudden movements, so that the rider can calm the horse and regain control of the situation before it escalates.

q: There is a fire in a tunnel. Are you allowed to turn around ?
e: Accidents - In case of fire, park the car on the right side of the roadway. Leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.
optionb: Yes, only if there are two lanes in your direction.

q: Which sign do you see before the sign end of priority road ?
e: CROSSING AND TRAFFIC SIGNS - Sign 1 = priority at the next intersection. Sign 2 = priority road. Sign 3 = one-way street.

q: The electric car that was driving in front of you in the tunnel has caught fire. What do you do ?
e: Accidents - In case of fire in a tunnel, park the car on the right-hand lane. Leave the keys in the ignition and exit the tunnel through the emergency exit.
optiona: You get out to see if you can help.
optionb: You drive backwards, fearing the car might explode.
optionc: You park your car and leave the tunnel through the emergency exit.

q: The ladder extends 1 meter in front of the car body. Is the driver allowed to drive like this ?
e: LOAD AND PASSENGER SEAT - A load may never extend beyond the front of the car body. At the rear, it may extend a maximum of 1 meter. If you need to transport a load that is longer and indivisible or cannot be collapsed or folded, it may extend up to 3 meters behind the car body, provided that you attach this warning panel to the rear of the load.
optiona: Yes, because it is a maximum of 1 meter.
optionb: Yes, if he signals the protruding load.

q: Which vehicles are you not allowed to overtake with your car after this sign ?
e: The Bicycle lane - This sign marks the beginning of a bicycle zone. In a bicycle zone, motor vehicles (including mopeds) are not allowed to overtake cyclists, speed pedelecs and bicycles up to 1 m wide. Other vehicles may be overtaken if they are driving too slowly. The maximum permitted speed in a bicycle zone is 30 km/h.
optionb: Only a cyclist and a class A moped.
optionc: A cyclist, a class A moped and a motorcycle.

q: Which vehicles are you NOT allowed to overtake with your car past this sign ?
e: The Bicycle lane - This sign marks the beginning of a bicycle zone. In a bicycle zone, motor vehicles (including mopeds) are not allowed to overtake cyclists, speed pedelecs and bicycles up to 1 m wide. Other vehicles may be overtaken if they are driving too slowly. The maximum permitted speed in a bicycle zone is 30 km/h.
optionb: Only a cyclist and a step.
optionc: A cyclist, a step and a speed pedelec.

q: When are you allowed to drive with snow chains on your tires ?
e: TECHNIQUE - In Belgium, snow chains may only be used when there is snow or ice on the road. Vehicles equipped with chains are not subject to any special speed limit, but drivers must always adapt their speed to the road conditions. For safety reasons, it is preferable to place snow chains on all four wheels. If only two are used, they must be fitted on the driving wheels.
optionb: When there is snow or ice on the road.

q: Are towing services allowed to drive on the hard shoulder while working ?
e: The Motorway - Police, emergency services and towing services (while working) may drive on the hard shoulder, the peak-hour lane and the emergency corridor.

q: You are driving your car in a new municipality in Flanders. What is the maximum speed you may drive past this sign on a normal road ?
e: SPECIAL PLACES - The yellow sign with a red border only indicates the administrative start of a municipality. It does NOT indicate the start of a built-up area and has no other meaning.

q: There are no traffic signs. Are these cars parked correctly ?
e: WAITING AND PARKING - The cars are parked on the shoulder. But there is no 1.5 meter of free space left for the pedestrian. These cars must be parked on the roadway.

q: The car is parked on the roadway, 30 cm from the shoulder. Is it correctly parked ?
e: WAITING AND PARKING - The shoulder is several meters wide. The car must be parked on the shoulder. More than 1.5 meters of free space remains for pedestrians.

q: Is the grey car in the correct lane to turn right ?
e: PRIORITY WHEN TURNING OFF - The car must be positioned at least in the right lane and was even allowed to use the last meters of the bus lane.

q: The blue car is entering the intersection. Is the driver allowed to do that ?
e: Priority from the right - At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.
optiona: Yes, because he has priority from the right.
optionb: No, because the red car is going straight ahead.

q: The blue car is entering the intersection. Is the driver allowed to do that ?
e: Priority from the right - At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.

q: The blue car is entering the intersection. Is the driver allowed to do that ?
e: Priority from the right - At intersections where: there is no authorized officer, no traffic lights, and no signs regulating priority, the rule of priority to the right applies. This means that every driver (of a car, motorcycle, two-wheeled moped, or bicycle) must yield to a driver coming from the right, except when driving on a roundabout or when the driver coming from the right is coming from a prohibited direction.
optiona: Yes, because he is going straight ahead.
optionb: Yes, because he has priority from the right.

q: You want to leave the motorway. Where should you brake ?
e: The Motorway - Of course, there is no rule that obliges you to still drive 120 km/h just before the exit. You may already drive a bit slower before reaching the exit. But actual braking, meaning pressing the brake pedal, should only be done once you are on the exit lane.
optionc: Only once you are on the exit lane.

q: A roadway without markings. Is the black car allowed to overtake the grey one on the left ?
e: OVERTAKING ON THE LEFT - If the roadway is wide enough to keep a safe lateral distance and the maneuver can be done safely, it is allowed to overtake another vehicle on the left on this roadway (unless a traffic sign prohibits it).

q: A roadway divided into traffic lanes. May the black car overtake the grey one on the left ?
e: The Lanes - If a roadway is divided into lanes by a broken white line, you may cross that line to overtake a vehicle on the left, provided it is safe to do so and no traffic sign prohibits overtaking.

q: A roadway divided into traffic lanes. May the black car overtake the grey one on the left ?
e: The Lanes - You may not cross a continuous white line between lanes to overtake another vehicle.

q: May a user of a motorized personal mobility device be overtaken by motor vehicles in a bicycle zone ?
e: The Bicycle lane - Users of motorized personal mobility devices are treated the same as cyclists. In a bicycle zone, cyclists may not be overtaken by motor vehicles. This overtaking ban also applies to motorcycles and mopeds of class A and B. The speed pedelec, however, is considered a bicycle and may overtake other cyclists. On the other hand, cyclists may overtake each other and other road users. Overtaking must always be done on the left. A cyclist may also pass stationary vehicles on the right. Priority vehicles (police, fire brigade, ambulance with siren and flashing light) are still allowed to overtake cyclists. If a priority vehicle is approaching, clear the roadway.

q: You are driving at 105 km/h on an ordinary road in Flanders. What is the consequence ?
e: SPEED - The maximum permitted speed on an ordinary road in Flanders is 70 km/h. You are therefore driving 35 km/h too fast. 1. Immediate temporary withdrawal of the driving licence.  You risk an immediate withdrawal of your licence as soon as you exceed the speed limit by more than 30 km/h on motorways, expressways, and ordinary roads. 2. Disqualification from the right to drive a motor vehicle (judge). -You risk disqualification as soon as you exceed the speed limit by more than 40 km/h on those same roads.
optionb: An immediate withdrawal of your driving licence.
optionc: You will have to appear in court.

q: You are approaching this bridge. If an oncoming vehicle approaches, who has the right of way ?
e: Crossing - There is a road narrowing. The blue priority sign means that you have the right of way.

q: You are approaching this bridge and see this traffic sign. What does it mean ?
e: Crossing - This warning sign means road narrowing.  The sign that indicates a reduction of lanes is a blue information sign.

q: You are driving at 75 km/h within a built-up area in Flanders. What are the consequences ?
e: SPEED - 1. If you drive in a built-up area, a 30-zone, or a residential area at more than 20 km/h above the speed limit, you risk an immediate withdrawal of your driving licence.
